revision.comment: /* top */clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|brand = Linksys |model = E1000 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = v2.0 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = August 2, 2010 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/Linksys_E1000_v2.0 |wlclass = N300 |series = E1000 |type = wireless router |sernum = CVN1 |fcc_id = Q87-E1000V2, Q87-M10V2 |icid = 3839A-E1000V2 |us_id = <!-- US ID --> |boardid = 3763-11200502R |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM5357B0;(BCM5357B); |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 74K |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 300 <!-- 300 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = Serial |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;MX25L3206E;MX 25L3205D; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = 3801088 bytes
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = Winbond;W9425G6JH-5;SK hynix H5DU2562GTR; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = 32
|eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = IEEE 802.3/3u |portbasedvlan = <!-- Support for port based vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |802.1qvlan = <!-- Support for 802.1q vlan tagging, Leave blank for unknown --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = 98:FC:11 |oui = 98:FC:11
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = CFE;;; |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 0.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = yes |jtag = yes
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = <!-- Leave blank --> |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = DD-WRT, Tomato (shibby)
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 05/18/2010 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = 7.95" x 1.34" x 6.3" (202 x 34 x 160 mm) |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 28 |rad1cap = <!-- radio capabilities, Leave blank for none or unknown -->
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== E1000 v2 serial numbers appear to start with '''CVN1'''.
"3763-11200502R" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. The hardware appears to be the same as the [[Cisco Valet M10 v2]].
The default SSID is probably '''CiscoXXXXX''' where '''XXXXX''' is the last 5 digits of the serial number. If the device has been configured with Cisco Connect the device will probably have a [[Cisco Connect SSIDs|randomly generated SSID]].
Supported by [http://tomato.groov.pl/download/K26RT-N/ K26RT-N] builds of Tomato by Shibby.
==Links of Interest== [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_routers Listed on the 'Linksys routers' page on Wikipedia] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=80969 E1000 V2 On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=105008 Linksys e1000v2 now supported On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum]
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== {{DDWRTNotice|k24req}} Supported by dd-wrt as of = 16758 *[ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/V24-K26/svn16758/dd-wrt.v24-16758_NEWD-2_K2.6_mini_e1000v2.bin dd-wrt.v24-16758_NEWD-2_K2.6_mini_e1000v2.bin]
Please enter flashing instrustions here
